alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:11PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sumner County through 445 PM CDT... At 410 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm just southwest of South Haven, or 8 miles southeast of Caldwell, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, South Haven, Geuda Springs and Hunnewell. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Kansas.
